title: The best item in the game is...
body:
{{item:3046}} 
Not because of its stats no. It's because of its passive. Being able to move through units is a extremely powerful thing. How times have you died or a kill got away because you got stuck on minions? It's especially good considering the horrible path finding unit collision this game has.

replies.body:
I've always wondered. Why is unit collision even a thing? Whats the point in it existing?

Given that League is the only moba I ever played, this might be something easily lost on me but if anyone could elaborate I'd be glad.

OT: We should also have boots that let you ignore unit collision, or at least a boot enchant

Because if we're walking over the minions. They'd have to animate that. 

And if we can walk over minions. Then we can walk over Yordles. 

If we can walk over Yordles. We can smush them if your feet. 

If we can smush them if our feet. We can step on Teemo. 

If we stepped on Teemo. We'd detonate every shroom he has. 

If we detonate every shroom Teemo has, the world would end. 

In short. Riot likes not dying.

Except that most devourer jungles have no real impact on the game for 15-20 minutes, and the other team should snowball hard enough in that time.

That is a common misconception. With devourer, you can still gank and pressure lanes. Getting a kill or assist is the same as killing a monster in jungle. Plus most junglers don't apply much pressure pre-6, so the window to get ahead is pretty small.

Banner of Command is extremely underrated -- it's stronger than Locket is versus double AP solo lane comps, since neither solo laner can respond to the minion to kill it.  A team is forced to either give up a lot of damage to their tower in a side lane, or send their AD Carry to answer the Banner minion; a lose-lose situation.
